hook.text: A Boston Marathon runner died in 2002 from drinking too much water. Overhydration can be fatal.

buildup.text: Hyponatremia occurs when excess water dilutes blood sodium to dangerous levels, causing brain swelling.

discovery.text: Over 1,600 marathon runners develop hyponatremia annually. Slower runners who drink constantly are most at risk.

twist.text: The advice to 'drink before thirst' caused more harm than dehydration in endurance events.

climax.text: Guidelines now recommend drinking to thirstâ€”not on a scheduleâ€”during endurance exercise.

punchline.text: Too much water is as dangerous as too little.
